DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Clinician Assessment Skin Response Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the chronic graft versus host disease response for skin based on clinician assessment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Clinician Assessment Skin Disease Response
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._An individual, such as a physician or nurse practitioner, who takes responsibility for a patient's care during an encounter._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages._The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A graft versus host disease with symptoms appearing more than 100 days post-transplant.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

Property.preferredDefinition: An individual, such as a physician or nurse practitioner, who takes responsibility for a patient's care during an encounter.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.:The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Concepts.definition: An individual, such as a physician or nurse practitioner, who takes responsibility for a patient's care during an encounter.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CCR 16C0094 study as requested by P.Asangong. mc 4/25/16

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Increase in NIH Skin Score by 1 or more points, except 0 to 1

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Increase in NIH Skin Score by 1 or more points, except 0 to 1
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An NIH skin score that has increased by 1 or more points, except 0 to 1.

Concepts.definition: An NIH skin score that has increased by 1 or more points, except 0 to 1.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Decrease NIH Skin Score by 1 or more points

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Decrease NIH Skin Score by 1 or more points
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An NIH skin score that has decreased by 1 or more points.

Concepts.definition: An NIH skin score that has decreased by 1 or more points.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: NIH Skin Score 0 after previous involvement

ValueMeaning.preferredName: NIH Skin Score 0 after previous involvement
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An NIH skin score of 0 after previous GvHD involvement.

Concepts.definition: An NIH skin score of 0 after previous GvHD involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for CCR 16C0094 study as requested by P.Asangong. mc 4/25/16
